website_summaries.verdict: Despite some quirks, this is a versatile step stool that's perfect for most consumers who need the added security of an easy-to-grip handrail.
pros: Earns high marks for safety, thanks to the handrail and slip-resistant surface
Has rubber-coated feet and soft-grip handle coating for added stability
Can also be used without the handrail
cons: Assembly is somewhat confusing and time consuming

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the step stool in September of 2017. It is now December 2017. The band around the step is falling off and the rubber tread on top of the step is completely loose. I have only used this stool to step into bed. I do not recommend buying this step stool.
customer_reviews.author: Sunstone505

customer_reviews.title: Someone needs to learn how to read a ruler.
customer_reviews.text: The step stool is fine, but the measurement Amazon gives in the information is wrong..the top. measures 10 x 14 x 9 H, they have it listed as 12 x 16 x 9 H, that is a big difference, I already have one 10 x 14 x 9 H.....I needed a larger size..... sizes on many things are listed wrong....some one is not doing their job......it is a waste of my time and money when this happens.
customer_reviews.author: Joan L.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturing of this product is poor at best. The bolt holes in the step legs are almost bigger than the bolts and present a safety issue for the user. The assembly instructions and actual assembly are total different. I had to purchase larger and thicker washers in order to assemble this item and have it safe enough for my mother to use without injury.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Blakley

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart upon first use
customer_reviews.text: This feels very solid and sturdy as far as standing on it, but it is very poorly made. The first day I used it the metal trim began coming off. My husband had to nail it back on because it wouldn't stay on. The rubber mat on top also keeps coming off. We've tried gluing it on multiple times and it won't adhere. I've only had it a week. Also, it weighs over 8 pounds, not 5 like the description says. If it weren't a pain to unassemble or if I weren't so limited from surgery, I'd return it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Leibfried

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I saw one like this while visiting a relative in the hospital. Gave theirs a "test run" and decided I had to go looking for a like product. 30 second on Amazon and there it was. Not cheap but an excellent value for the price. Very solid (I weight 250) and a larger than usual top step. Love the handle to avoid the bending to move it around. Wish I had it years ago. Get one, I can't believe you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Salmons

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stool For Handicap Use
customer_reviews.text: This stool is very stable. The handle is perfect for allowing a place to hold on for balance and extra assistance pulling one's self up. The stool is not adjustable, and the height is a little high for where our son is in his recovery, so we just added a lower stool at the base of this one. He makes a two step process to get into the car. He uses the handle on this stool as an anchor for both steps. I highly recommend this step for people who need assistance and are able to use the onesided handle. The rubber surface is slip free.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney L Joplin

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product came damaged so I can't really give a fair review. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: DebPet

customer_reviews.title: Check before you begin to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Check the pre-drilled holes (by inserting the screws) before you begin to assemble! The first step stool I received, it was on the final piece of assembly where I found the pre-drilled hole was blocked by a piece of the metal. It was a complete pain to "return" with amazon! The step stool was basically assembled. Who wants to disassemble to put back in to a flat box to return a defective item. After several communications, they finally resent a new one. On the second, only one of the pre-drilled holes was not 100% aligned but made it work. It's together and serves its purpose great!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Stable and safe
customer_reviews.text: I gave it four stars because I found it difficult to assemble -- but that might just be me. I have very little experience assembling furniture and and the illustrations in the instructions could have been clearer. I was every nervous that I would make a mistake in assembling. It took me some time to make sure I had done it correctly. My mother and I both use it and it's great to have around the house. ..
customer_reviews.author: JeanieQ

customer_reviews.title: Horrible instructions on assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is adequate. It appears to be sturdy enough for what I need. I recently got a new bed that is a little higher than my old one. I needed a step to get in the bed. This will do the job but will replace it with something better in the future. The instructions are a nightmare. I do not like to put things together but can if the instructions are clear. These are not. I would not have bought it if I had know the instructions were so bad. Would not recommend. Really irritated right now.
customer_reviews.author: susan d.

customer_reviews.title: Evidently a returned item with missing/replaced part and stunk
customer_reviews.text: I did not get it put together Yet as the smallest screw (said to use it to put legs together) was less than 1” (sitting above tape measure in photo) and was not color marked as stated. So must go to hardware store to purchase new screw which will fit. In addition when opening the box It all reeked of cigarette smoke of which I am allergic. Had to immediately move packing materials out of the house and spray the stool pieces with Fabreeze. I assume this stool was returned and not new. It is a gift for a friend having surgery tomorrow so I am not happy with this transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Duffin

customer_reviews.title: missing installation parts
customer_reviews.text: missing parts needed for installation. I'm in a remote part of Texas and dont know if I should drive 15 miles to a hardware store and try to purchase the nuts and bolts I need, or return this product. Also, the step is made of particle board... I likely wouldn't have purchased if I'd known that.
customer_reviews.author: sell_it_atx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stool to use for knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: Saw this stool at my rehab for knee replacement. I use it to get into truck for it can be very difficult just after knee replacement. I also use it by my bed to have something to pull upon getting out of bed. Wish I had gotten one sooner. I have another replacement coming up in the next few months and glad I will already have this stool.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control...
customer_reviews.text: Received promptly. Adequate instructions. Pieces of pressed out metal remaining attached in some bolt holes. Had to be “punched” out with a small round screwdriver before bolts could be entered into prepunched holes. Some screws did not align up with the screw legs in base. Finally had to use a hammer and “force” to be able to start bolts. Then had to force bolts through holes with a Phillips bit on a electric drill and a ratchet. Unit does not set level on the floor but is fine once you stand on it. Thought about sending it back to Amazon, but too much of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I just had a bilateral total knee replacement and needed help getting into my bed. We have a big bed/mattress and I needed a step up so I can turn around and then sit on the bed. This stool is easy to assemble and very sturdy. The hand rail is great. The only slight issue I had the first time I used it was that the step is 9" up. It felt like I needed a 3" step to get up onto the 9" step.. however, I got past that and the next night was able to step up without help. I love the platform, it is big enough for me to turn around.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and incredibly useful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to aid my husband after his hip replacement surgery as our bed is a bit high. I am sooo glad I bought this version with the handle. It has been helpful getting him in and out of the high bed as well as in and out of the tub. And today it helped me organize the top shelf of my closet. So all in all the most useful purchase I made to aid in his recovery. And it also has useful in just everyday life. Super sturdy and very easy to pit together. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ewastoria

customer_reviews.title: Silver trim coming off after a week!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly mother to get into bed. The silver trim around the step was popping off AFTER A WEEK! But I had already gotten rid of the box so I didn't know how to return it. My mom thinks it's sturdy to step on but the loose metal rim is a trip hazard or it could cut her foot. Yesterday we glued the silver part back on so I am hoping it stays on. The manufacturer should use more GLUE. Anyone buying this is probably elderly so they should be more cautious.
customer_reviews.author: cwls

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: We are using this just for the handle. We put it next to our bathtub and use the handle for balance to help us get in and out of the tub. We had ordered a tub rail which did not fit our tub so we ordered this stool and it is just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The handle is why I bought it
customer_reviews.text: This is both good and bad for me. I am short with poor balance and it is hard for me to use step stools. This has a handle and mskes it easy to use, takes up little room. My problem is I can not raise my feet/legs do not go up very far and the step is almost to high but the handle helps.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: STURDY!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for vacation for mom to get into a high bed. I am at times technically challenged....spouse put it together...was not difficult. I just had brain block. We could not take it back on plane, friends took it to use...they were impressed. May replace the one we have at home. Would recommend in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect after stroke
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my mother after she had a stroke as she was having trouble getting up into the bed and reaching things up high in the kitchen. She loves it and having that handle gives her the security that a regular step stool doesn't. The step is just the right height so she's able to step up without too much trouble. I recommend this for anyone who may be a fall risk but just needs a little help.
customer_reviews.author: DANA A

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and doesn't tip
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother who had a heart attack, and bypass surgery this summer. I drive a Jeep, so it's hard for her to get in and out, even more so after having open heart surgery. This little step stool is perfect. It's easy to put in the back of the Jeep, all the rubber grips keep it from slipping or tipping over. Plus the handle gives her a little more control when she's stepping up versus a regular step stool. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a 0 star rating I would. The instructions were impossible to follow. The diagram on the back of the instruction sheet fell off the edges of the paper. The numbered parts of the stool did not match up correctly. Not all sizes of the screws listed on the parts included were included. I went to Lowe's and bought the size screws the instructions called for. My nephew tried to put it together for me, and the sizes of screws, bolts, etc still didn't fit. I can't decide if I'm more frustrated or angry. If I could return this stool I would. I'll go buy an already put together step stool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wobbly
customer_reviews.text: It didn't matter how I put it together, one leg ended up shorter than the other, so it wobbles back and forth... Otherwise ok.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Decent stool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This stool seems reasonable for the money. It seems fairly sturdy and it was relatively inexpensive. Mine was missing one of the screws needed for assembly. I was able to find a suitable screw in my garage, so it wasn't a huge deal, but you expect all the hardware to be included in the packaging. If not for that issue, I would have given a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Forestrunner

customer_reviews.title: Great step up for anybody
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my new bed is way to high to get on. This has been great for me. It's strong and doesn't move when you step on it. I will use to get things down I'm to short fo reach too. I highly recommend it and the handle is great if you need something to balance with while on it. I have 3 broken vertebrae and as they heal I suffer from loss of use of my legs sometimes. This is great for me when I'm standing on it because I can hold onto the handle till the problem passes if I'm on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Better than good all around.
customer_reviews.text: This stool is great all around. I would add one small feature, though. The screws that attach the handle to the legs stick out just a bit. Even though they are exposed on the inside, I think little rubber caps for the ends would add a little safety. The material and the design are of better than good quality. The stool is well balanced and heavy enough to be used by any age group.
customer_reviews.author: Marie brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea!
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my mom after hip surgery to get into her bed which is high. After putting together and taking apart multiple times, it still slightly wobbly since one leg is shorter than the other for some reason. Put a pad on the bottom and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gayla

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT solution to a vertical challenge
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size, very sturdy, easy to carry around where needed. I don't feel like I'm going to fall, and I can reach most of my shelves when I need to without carrying a large step-ladder around.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to every detail of your order!
customer_reviews.text: Well here I go. Product was well worth the buy. No doubt about it. My problem lay in the ordering. First of all please pay attention to little details of your order. It wasn't adjustable, so my mom couldn't step up high enough to stand on the step. Had to mail it back. Postage was free of course, but had to buy another box to fit handle. So second of all, never throw away your box till you're sure you're going to keep the product!!! Cost me $12.61. Lol my bad.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: No more jumping on the bed for granny!
customer_reviews.text: My 84 year old grandmother recently moved in with us. Well she is a little bitty short woman and her rear barely touched the top of the bed. I got this for her to stand on to get on the bed and to step on getting off of the bed. It works perfect! Very easy to assemble and very sturdy for it to not be braced down to anyrhing.
customer_reviews.author: Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Love How Stable/Sturdy It Is
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money.. going to use it to get out of my cargo van which is way TOO OFF THE GROUND for me... and this will give me something more stable to hold onto.. Also, the weight capacity was a plus!
customer_reviews.author: peacelily

customer_reviews.title: A little small, therefore a little unstable
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice aid for getting into bed. And, when you first go to bed at night, no problem. However, getting up in the middle of the night to potty, you'd better hit this right, or you may go a_s over tea kettle. Since my wife will be using this following hip replacement surgery, tomorrow, I'm going to have her wake me when she needs to get up.
customer_reviews.author: Madelyn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & safe
customer_reviews.text: My husband was in a horrific auto accident & needed something to help him get into bed as our bed is rather higher than most. His physical therapist suggested a stool with a handle. Looked on Amazon & found this stool. It is very sturdy & allows him to grab the bar, step on the stool & get into bed. Well made. The price is great. So glad I found this product. A real value!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Suburban vs Grandma
customer_reviews.text: My 90-year-old mom has trouble getting into my Suburban, so I ordered this stool. While it was quite difficult to assemble (holes too small or drilled off-kilter, skimpy instructions, etc) it was very helpful when I used it for the first time yesterday. Mom is very overweight, and it felt secure and supportive. The step is broad enough for her to stand with both feet before using the handle to stabilize to step up to the running board. Also used it for her to exit where she slid from the seat onto the stool, supporting herself with the handle and car door. Nifty! She felt very good about using it.
customer_reviews.author: momtime

customer_reviews.title: STRONG AND WELL MADE, GOOD PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I do medical exams for people with disabilities and sometimes getting up on the exam table is difficult for them so I bought this to create a stable step-up for them. I was surprised that they use it for that purpose without direction and in many other ways spontaneously to increase/aid their stability when performing range-of-motion testing. I'm really glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not clear. Not sure how durable this is going to be.
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to the clear and well-written instructions that come with Japanese products. This product is from China, and the directions were barely adequate. I'll have see how well it holds up, but I will definitely pay more attention to the country of origin before I order another such item.
customer_reviews.author: Marcheta

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my kitchen so I can reach the top shelves. It is amazingly sturdy and I love the handle that makes it so easy to move from place to place. It was relatively easy to assemble, although the holes for the handle were not punched all the way through so it took a little more effort than anticipated. Definitely a good find.
customer_reviews.author: K Rock

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: Step with handle is perfect for people with arthritis. We set it outside at our front step before elderly people arrive. They appreciate the extra support of the handle!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product was easy to assemble and makes those higher shelf’s a little more assesible. I have vertigo and get off balance very easy on a regular step stool. The handle is great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is helping me get in and out of bed with a walking boot. Stability is ok, I think the step itself needs to be wider. It is nice looking, and I could see we may use it for other things in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Pianone

customer_reviews.title: My bed is on the higher side so this has been great for my recovery
customer_reviews.text: I just recently had major back surgery and this stool has made my life so much easier. I didnt know they even sell this typr of product but a friend surprised me with it when i got home. My bed is on the higher side so this has been great for my recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy step assist stool for hip surgery patient
customer_reviews.text: This stool was purchased for my wife after her hip replacement. She used this to help her get in and out of the bed. It was also used to assist her getting in and out of the vehicle. Nice strong grab handle allowed her to keep her balance.
customer_reviews.author: Key Largo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and helpful
customer_reviews.text: This has been so helpful. I had extensive back surgery and needed help getting in and out of bed. This is so sturdy I also used it to get in and out of the tub for shower. I am later going to add a 4" mattress topper, so me being short I will continue to use step.
customer_reviews.author: Marileewee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, non slip, safe.
customer_reviews.text: My bed is too high for me to get in easily. This step is excellent. Sturdy and easy to use. Handle helps. Doesn’t slip. I’ve tried other steps, but they weren’t as sturdy. They often ended up under the bed. This is much safer. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: User beware, a bit unstable - just ok
customer_reviews.text: Poor instructions that make no sense. It’s solid however you must pay attention when stepping in it - be sure to place your feet in the center of the foot pad or else it will fall over. I would return it if I could but since I have no use of one arm and one leg i.e. the reason I need this thing, it’s difficult to re box and return.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Useful, good quality and stable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, the first one I use at work and when I got a new bed my mattress is 13" tall with a 3" inch memory foam topper I am only 5'2" thus the need for a second beside my bed so I can get into it. It is stable and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: cassandra swanson

customer_reviews.title: Foot stool with handle
customer_reviews.text: This is for my Mom to use in and out of bed. Sturdy as long as you I have 1 foot on the stool and one hand on the handle do not use the handle by itself it will not Sustain your weight and balance It can wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Patton

customer_reviews.title: Smells like smoke!
customer_reviews.text: I love the stool. However, it reeks of smoke. Kept in in a walk-in closet and all my clothes smell like smoke. I moved it outside for five days, put it back in closet and it still reeks of smoke. Help!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Gresham

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Very easily assembled and quite sturdy. The handle provides just that little bit extra sense of safety so necessary for independent living. As a precaution I made sure my aunt was completely comfortable and safe with using the product before I left it for her use on her own.
customer_reviews.author: LillyMax

customer_reviews.title: Extremely helpful for my disability!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game-changer for me for getting into and out of bed, which sits high off the ground. I have inflammatory arthritis and have limited mobility when it flares. This step-stool is the perfect height for me and my short stature of 5'4". I can get into bed more easily and also sit at the edge of my bed without leg pain. And the handle is very helpful in getting up and out of bed as well. I should have bought one of these so much sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the most stable thing in the world
customer_reviews.text: I'm still somewhat young and feel comfortable using this for the occasional boost in height. I wouldn't feel comfortable for my aging parents using this in their day to day life. The included wrench is garbage, so make sure you have an extra wrench around when assembling it. The instructions were easy to follow and it went together pretty easily. The 4 legs on it weren't 100% level when I tightened everything down. Not super wobbly for me, but more than I'd want for my parents using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DMI step stool
customer_reviews.text: My step stool was just as the seller described. My stool arrived two days ahead of time. It was very easy to put together and it is very sturdy. I highly recommend making the purchase if anyone is thing of buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Castaldo

customer_reviews.title: Keeps You Steady
customer_reviews.text: Is so easy to put together. Helps you stay steady while on step, but also to get up and down. I have other step stools, but this one is so much better. Also, doesn't break your bank account.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Well made step!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe I paid only 31.08 for this outstanding step with shipping! Heavy duty! Common sense tells us to position yourself carefully not on the edge but centered on any step when climbing to keep it stable. This step is stable. This step helps with our day to day living being disabled is a challenge. Helps keep us living independently safely.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Janise

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandmother who has stage 4 breast cancer and neuropathy in her feet and hands. This was so easy to put together and now she can get onto her bed at night without fear of falling. Wonder item.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This stool is great, but... The “metal” border around the platform began to pull out of the board. I’m very disappointed because this was perfect until it wasn’t. I haven’t even had it a month! 😔
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Functional but Smells Bad
customer_reviews.text: This stool is sturdy and stable, and is exactly what I was looking for in terms of function. Would have given it 5 stars if the rubber material didn't give off a very strong unpleasant odor...it reminds me of an ashtray smell...hoping it will stop de-gassing soon...may have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sun and surf

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great step stool. It is so sturdy and has real good grip on the bottom keeping it from slipping. I also like the hand rail for better stability on getting up and down.
customer_reviews.author: alvinleejohnson

customer_reviews.title: Assurance of safety for a frail lady.
customer_reviews.text: After resisting for several years because of my wife's age and infirmity, I finally chose this product. It was promptly delivered, very easy to assemble, and most of all I can trust her to use it without constant fear of her falling. She uses it to reach the upper kitchen cabinets, and is happy being able to do so. (She is only 4'11" and 83 years old.) It's inexpensive, easy to move around, and sure-footed. Happy wife, happy life!
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Ernest William's

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Wife hurt knee this stool really helps her in & out of bed , some reviews showed screws poking thru bottom step they must have put the handle screws on step & the step screws on handle ! When't together great looks good !
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y.

customer_reviews.title: Seems good, but missing a part
customer_reviews.text: I am missing one of the two end caps that go into the chrome tubing of the handle. I, in no means, wish to return the product, but it would be nice to have a cap sent to me. Menards does not have the caps
customer_reviews.author: Norman G. Triplett

customer_reviews.title: I DON'T KNOW WHY I THOUGHT THIS LOOKED LIKE IT WAS 4 INCHES WHICH I COULD STILL HAVE ...
customer_reviews.text: THERE IS NOTHING WRONG WITH THIS LITTLE STEP STOOL HOWEVER SOMEHOW I THOUGHT IT WAS LOWER THAN IT IS.. I HAVE A HARD TIME STEPPING UP ON STAIRS...MY GRANDSON MADE ME 3 1/2 INCH STEPS FOR ME TO GET UP ONTO MY PORCH HERE...I'VE HAD OPEN HEART SURGERY, AND 2 BACK SURGERIES..WHICH HAS HINDERED MY STEPPING UP...I CAN STEP DOWN BY DROPPING ONE FOOT DOWN FOLLOWED BY MY OTHER FOOT AND SO ON. I DON'T KNOW WHY I THOUGHT THIS LOOKED LIKE IT WAS 4 INCHES WHICH I COULD STILL HAVE USED...OH WELL, IT WILL COME IN HANDY FOR ONE OF MY KIDS...THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: Betty Allen in care of Sharon Berkobien

customer_reviews.title: We were able to figure it out relatively easily thought. One person can assemble it
customer_reviews.text: Newer mattresses are very thick, so I have trouble climbing into my bed after knee surgery. This step is just the right height, and the handle helps me maintain my balance. The directions for assembly were a little confusing because the diagrammed instructions did not match the actual product. We were able to figure it out relatively easily thought. One person can assemble it, but an extra set of hands are helpful. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: James R Harrison Jr

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile step stool
customer_reviews.text: Used to get into a tall bed. I had an earlier one just like it that I gave to an older lady who needed it to get into her new bed, so this was a replacement. A good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ann L. Allman

customer_reviews.title: Not made for safe assembly
customer_reviews.text: There is no hole where there should be which makes me scared for the stability of the product. Needed it set today while I leave for a trip. My mother needs this to complete daily tasks like showering and now I’m scared it’s unsafe. Incredibly frustrating. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Good product. We purchased this so my 97 year old mother can climb into our pickup truck. It works well. Additionally, I use it in the kitchen to reach the top shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Memer

customer_reviews.title: Additional step into RV
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use as an additional step with handrail for entrance into RV. It works great, allows for use within the RV without using a ladder and serves multi functions. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Candycooks

customer_reviews.title: This is as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: this step stool is really strong, I weigh 250 lbs and I feel very secure getting up and down and standing on this stool. I I use this to reach a very high shelf in my closet. I highly recommend this stool. Love it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lagman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdiest of the stool. I do have a few years on me but not the pounds. I need to take it grocery shopping. I am 5’2 and have a time getting grocery items.
customer_reviews.author: Sbrunson

customer_reviews.title: A godsend after bilateral knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy - Stable - used to assist getting into and out of a large SUV after bilateral knee replacement. Also used to facilitate exercises to break up scar tissue to encourage straight leg that better enables walking and less pain during recovery. Now use it to access top shelves in the kitchen. Wish I would have had it sooner for those top kitchen shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Lois McNicol

customer_reviews.title: Help for a "shortie"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter. I have one that I use a lot because I am a bit handicapped and like the bar that you can grab if you need too. These are in most doctor's offices, so you know they are very useful, not just for sick people but for people like my daughter who, at 5 foot can't reach those high places. She saw mine and used it at my house and said she'd like to have one. (It also makes an excellent stool for little--or not so little--people to sit on and you can lean back on the handle if you want to.
customer_reviews.author: thatsme

customer_reviews.title: Very upset and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely upset. I'm having surgery tomorrow and needed this item badly. My husband just went to assemble it .... no screws included. Will be returning. No idea if he can find one in the morning locally!
customer_reviews.author: BSaint

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy step stool is great
customer_reviews.text: Love this step stool. I've had back surgery and struggle to manipulate my body sometimes. I use this to get in and out of bed. It has made may life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10 highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Got this so me and my mom could get into the back of the van easier. 10 out of 10 highly recommend. Super sturdy easy to get on and off and the no-slip grip is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Perkins

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK FOR OUR SITUATION
customer_reviews.text: Stool’s design does provide stability needed in our situation. The stool has a small footprint and although it is stable in terms of its construction it is not stable in unique situation
customer_reviews.author: Buds

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have
customer_reviews.text: We now have two of these. One sits next to the bed and the other in the kitchen. Having the handle to grab give much support when standing on it. Great safety factor any time you need a boost. Easy to move from place to place too.
customer_reviews.author: Mort Adella

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good purchase for us. My husband needs some help getting in and out of bed, and this is a tremendous help. I didn't give it a full five stars because it can get a little "tippy" on thick carpet unless you first put one foot on the step before relying on the handle to support you. He has learned to do that, and is very happy to be able to get in and out of bed without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Frances

customer_reviews.title: Best step by far
customer_reviews.text: I love this step stool. The handle is so wonderful for holding on to while reaching for things. Even though the handle does not fold, it fits perfectly under the kitchen island. The feet do not slide, making this very stable. Durable and strong.
customer_reviews.author: shoppingdiva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent step stool
customer_reviews.text: Great little stand. I use it for the wash area as our washer is deep and elevated so it is great for that purpose. It has held up excellent outside and is very well made. It definitely can handle 300+ weight. Highly recommend to anyone needing a stable step stool.
customer_reviews.author: tmybrgr

customer_reviews.title: Step stool with handle support
customer_reviews.text: I like the step fine. I did find it a little hard to put together and had to use a drill on the holes, but in the end it is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Essential Item for shorter personnel in the Kitchen. No more worrying about someone climbing onto counters to reach items. Wife, Daughter and Grand Daughter Use it daily! Strong and Sturdy! Perfect solution for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great DM5 foot store for seniors
customer_reviews.text: DMI stepstool was very helpful to get in on a very high bed. It was dirty enough for me to hold onto. I did not fall. It wasn’t shaky and it was good quality
customer_reviews.author: Chachi Family Account

customer_reviews.title: Use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I'm recovering from knee replacement, and use this stool all the time. I use it to help me get us as well as an extra height for places.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My GF had surgery and used a similar stool in the hospital. ( she is 5'). I bought this prior to her coming home and it was easy to put together. It is very sturdy which was a HUGE deal for her getting up onto the bed. Since her recovery, we now use it for a step stool or a sitting stool. It remains useful and sturdy...i did have ro tighten one screw once. It has been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: melissa r. smith

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Same thing used in many Drs. offices.
customer_reviews.text: Great to have beside my bed while recovering fron surgery. Secure feeling. Makes getting in and out of bed sooo much easier and much less painful. Plan to store it and use it in the pantry once I no longer need it bedside. Will be very handy in there.
customer_reviews.author: KSMoorman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. The handle is a must.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy step stool. We needed it to help my elderly mother into our truck. The handle is a huge help and the stool can be turned so the handle is on either side you need it.
customer_reviews.author: G Nahmens

customer_reviews.title: Very handy step.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when my husband had a hip replacement, but we have found so many other uses for it. We love the handle because you can step up and feel secure. It's perfect to reach up to get things from a shelf. It's very sturdy but light enough to move easily around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra C. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Stable
customer_reviews.text: "Some assembly required", but nothing extreme. A good step with brace, for kitchens or laundry rooms, or anywhere one must reach into upper cabinets or storage spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Lawhern

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Step
customer_reviews.text: This was a good value and a sturdy step. It was for someone who had just had knee surgery and was a great help to get in and out of a footed tub. I took a bit to put it together but it was very sturdy and designed to remain stable.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Gramling

customer_reviews.title: Goox quality and
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great. I bought one for my Dad and it worked so well I got one for my Mom. What drew me to this one is the handle. It makes it much easier to get in and out of bed. Just a step would not give that sense of stability. It's heavier than I expected and feels very sturdy. I would recommend this to anyone who need it.
customer_reviews.author: Odaicerp

customer_reviews.title: Would return if I could
customer_reviews.text: Holes for nuts and bolts do not line up. May be a defective one or wrong parts were sent but when I tried to arrange a return, it shows as being ineligible for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Lannie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: Great to use in the kitchen to get to top shelf items, like having the side handle to steady myself, and I like it for carrying it around instead of having to bend over and pick up off the floor. Great for older folks and those who can't bend over.
customer_reviews.author: BixFan

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 3 year old to be independent and safe.
customer_reviews.text: We actually needed a step stool for my 3 year old to reach a pedestal sink. This stool is sturdy enough that I don’t worry about him getting on and off and light enough we can move it if needed. The y’all handle helps him balance when he doesn’t have anything else to hold on to. Also, since it is only high on one side you can tuck it away without running into it. It was a great solution compared to all those wide, wobbly or no-handle stools.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mattli

customer_reviews.title: it is sturdy and works for what I need - getting into a high bed
customer_reviews.text: why I gave it only 4 stars is that I cannot get rid of the smell of the rubber tread. Any ideas of how to get rid of the smell which hasn't gone away after a week?
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great stool!
customer_reviews.text: This helps me get in and out of my claw foot tub/ shower. I don’t always trust my arthritic hips and this stool keeps me safer, the handle is literally a lifesaver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Step stool for bed
customer_reviews.text: I have seen and used in hospitals before. This one looks like those but I wish its lower step portion a little heavier so not tend to move as easily from where I put it.
customer_reviews.author: Swanlw

customer_reviews.title: Ensures Stability
customer_reviews.text: This stepstool has been in dispensable doing my rehabilitation. I am able to get into my elevated bed safely. The slip free surface ensures that my feet will stay where I put them as I step into the bed, and the bar provides stability and safety. I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: but I had my hip replaced and felt like I needed a better stool than the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a high bed, and I've always used a little stool to get up on the bed, but I had my hip replaced and felt like I needed a better stool than the one I had, and this is definitely my favorite. I'm so glad I got the one with the handle. It's good to hang on to something when I step up to get on our bed.
customer_reviews.author: HealthyMeMe

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to get legs even, prevent from rocking
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to get the legs even so that they don’t rock. The smell of the rubber is nauseatingly toxic chemical odor. Otherwise, fine.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Creed

product_meta.title: DMI Step Stool with Handle for Adults and Seniors Made of Heavy Duty Metal, Holds up to 300 Pounds with 9.5 Inch Step Up
product_meta.description:
Color:Step Stool With Handle

DURO-MED STEP STOOL WITH HANDLE, SILVER AND BLACK MEDICAL STEP STOOL
Get the extra height you need with stability and safety you can count on.

DURO-MED STEP STOOL WITH HANDLE IS GREAT FOR:

 * Stepping up to reach high cupboards
 * Stepping up into bed
 * Stepping up into vehicles
 * Stepping into or out of a bathtub

DURO-MED MEDICAL STEP STOOL WITH HANDLE FEATURES:

 * Stability handle
 * Non-slip textured matting
 * Light weight design is easy to lift and move around
 * Use with or without the handle

DURO-MED STEP STOOL WITH HANDLE SPECIFICATIONS:

 * 10 by 14.5 by 9 inches
 * Step height 9 inches
 * Recommended weight is 300 pounds
 * Step stool weight is 8.5 pounds
 * Contains latex

Click ‘Add To Cart’ Today 

Do not over tighten as it could strip the threads
feature_bullets: EASILY REACH OBJECTS out of your grasp with the support from a convenient handrail, providing safety and stability.
SAFELY STEP UP to higher beds, vehicles, cabinets and much more with this heavy duty medical step stool.
NON-SLIP TEXTURED MATTING and reinforced rubber tips enhance stability and provide additional safety for you and loved ones.
A CHROME-PLATED STEEL FRAME boasts a strong 300-pound weight capacity.

STEP STOOL SPECIFICATIONS: Step platform measures 10” (w) x 14.5” (l). Height of platform from floor: 9”. Handle height from floor is 34”. Overall dimensions: 17.3” (l) x 12.3” (w) x 34” (h). Weight Capacity: 300 lbs. Some assembly required. 1 each.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
